trans-unit.source: Defines the event that carries information about Web-request errors.
The <xref:System.Web.Management.WebRequestErrorEvent> is raised if an error occurs during a Web request.

Your application should use this event to obtain request-related information as defined by the <xref:System.Web.Management.WebRequestInformation> and the <xref:System.Web.Management.WebThreadInformation> classes.
In most cases you will use the standard ASP.NET health monitoring types and control their behavior by setting the `healthMonitoring` configuration section.
You can also create custom types, as shown in the next example.

If you create your custom event type and you need to add your own information, customize the <xref:System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent.FormatCustomEventDetails%2A> method, this will avoid overwriting or tampering with sensitive system information.
Initializes the <xref href="System.Web.Management.WebRequestErrorEvent"></xref> class with specified event parameters.
This constructor allows you to create a <xref:System.Web.Management.WebRequestErrorEvent> event without needing to specify detailed code information about the event itself.
The event description.
The object that is the source of the event.
The identifier associated with the event.
It must be greater than the <xref href="System.Web.Management.WebEventCodes.WebExtendedBase"></xref> field constant.
The <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> associated with the error.
Initializes the <xref href="System.Web.Management.WebRequestErrorEvent"></xref> class with specified event parameters.
Use this constructor if you need to specify detailed code information about the event.
The event description.
The object that is the source of the event.
The identifier associated with the event.
It must be greater than <xref href="System.Web.Management.WebEventCodes.WebExtendedBase"></xref> field constant.
The event detail code identifier.
The <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> associated with the error.
Used internally to increment the relevant performance counters.
Gets the application request information.
The standard request information is defined by the <xref:System.Web.Management.WebRequestInformation> class.
The application request information.
Gets the application thread information.
The standard thread information is defined by the <xref:System.Web.Management.WebThreadInformation> class.
The application thread information.
